result.execSummary:
The defendant Ivan V Ianakiev was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
In the Wisconsin State Prison System
Consecutive to: any other sentence

If revoked, defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year of initial confinement.

If revoked, all conditions of probation shall revert to ES conditions.
Court does not object to transfer of probation to Ozaukee County, if accepted.

miscConds.notes: Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department. Random urine screens.

No positive results. Maintain absolute sobriety. No illegal drugs. No controlled substances without valid prescription. No contact with drug community. No contact with co-actors or victims. (Sam S., Samuel R., Daniel N., Megan F., Desiree C., Molly J., Dyllan H., and Jimmy D.)
Seek and maintain full time employment.

Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done. Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge,  as a condition of probation. If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered. If revoked, DOC to collect out of up to 25% prison wages.Court ordered restitution in amount of zero.
Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

timeConds.notes: First 3 months FORTHWITH, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment. Second 3 months STAYED for use by agent for violations.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ivan V Ianakiev

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: State of Wisconsin Department of Corrections Discharge Certificate; received and filed.

Defendant Ivan V Ianakiev in court with attorney D Michael Guerin and Steven McGaver.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Court ordered restitution in the amount of $0.   The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 4 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 20 days 
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.


The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 
years with the following conditions:

*Serve condition time of 6 months in the HOC, FIRST 3 MONTH FORTHWITH, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  SECOND 3 MONTHS STAYED for use by agent for violations.  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*No contact with co-actors or victims.  (Sam S., Samuel R., Daniel N., Megan F., Desiree C., Molly J., Dyllan H., and Jimmy D.)
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

  - Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge,  as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.  If revoked, DOC to collect out of up to 25% prison wages.
- If revoked, Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year of initial confinement.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

**If revoked, all conditions of probation shall rever to ES conditions.   Court does not object to transfer of probation to Ozaukee County, if accepted.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Ivan V Ianakiev in court with attorney Steven C. McGaver.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.   Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Branch 26. 

As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons at any time in the future.
Defendant cannot vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Steven C. McGaver in court.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued and STAYED.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2014, this case will be assigned to:  Judge POCAN, Branch 26, in ROOM 634 of the COURTHOUSE.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Calendar call scheduled for August 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  kmw
Received and filed with court.
Defendant Ivan V Ianakiev in court with attorney Steven C McGaver.  Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  kmw

Defendant Ivan V Ianakiev in court with attorney Steven C McGaver.  Lucy J Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Stipulation and Order, signed and filed.  kmw
Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Attorney Michael G Penkwitz in court, defendant Ivan V Ianakiev not in court, in custody.  Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:33 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

**DEFENDANT OWES AN ADDITIONAL $1,500.00.  $1,000.00 PREVIOUSLY POSTED.**
Defendant was in custody on the March 25, 2014 Initial Appearance date.

Defendant Ivan V Ianakiev in court with attorney Michael Girard Penkwitz.  Defendant Ivan V Ianakiev in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
-Atty Penkwitz for DE.  kmw
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Ivan V Ianakiev not in court.  Karine E O'Byrne  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case. appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
